## **Related Publications**

### **CHoRUS Multimodal Linkage SOP**

**Publication**: CHoRUS Bridge2AI Standards Office

**Description**: Standard Operating Procedure for linking multimodal data (including waveforms) with electronic health records. This SOP introduced the waveform_registry table concept, which was later expanded into the 4-table Waveform Extension.

**Link**: [https://chorus-ai.github.io/Chorus_SOP/docs/Multimodal-Linkage/](https://chorus-ai.github.io/Chorus_SOP/docs/Multimodal-Linkage/)

<br>

## **External Resources**

### **PhysioNet**

PhysioNet provides open-access physiological data and waveform processing tools:

- [PhysioNet Database](https://physionet.org/)
- [WFDB Software Package](https://physionet.org/content/wfdb/)
- [MIMIC-IV Waveform Database](https://physionet.org/content/mimic4wdb/)

### **Waveform Standards**

- **EDF/EDF+**: [European Data Format Specification](https://www.edfplus.info/)

- **DICOM Waveform**: [DICOM Standard Part 3](https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.10.9.html)

If you use the OMOP CDM Waveform Extension in your research, please cite:

## **Community Contributions**

We encourage community members to share their work using the Waveform Extension:

- **Implementation case studies**: Share your ETL approach and lessons learned
- **Tool development**: Present utilities, converters, or analysis pipelines
- **Research applications**: Showcase studies using integrated waveform + EHR data
- **Validation studies**: Report data quality metrics and conformance testing

Submit presentation proposals via:
- **GitHub**: [Open an issue](https://github.com/OHDSI/WaveformWG/issues) with the "presentation" label
- **Email**: houghtaling@ohdsi.org
- **Teams**: Post in the Waveform Working Group channel
